text: Fairy bread is sliced white bread spread with butter or margarine and covered with "Hundreds and Thousands", often served at children's parties in Australia and New Zealand. It is typically cut into triangles. A similar breakfast item in The Netherlands and Belgium is known as hagelslag, which is the name of the sprinkles. ==References== Category:Breads Category:Australian food Category:Belgian food Category:Dutch food Category:New Zealand food
title: Fairy bread
